name.description: Must match the job directory name.

enabled.description: Whether this job is active. If false, cronctl will not install any cron entries for the job.

user.description: Linux user to run the job as (the USER column in /etc/cron.d).

env.description: Global environment variables written at the top of /etc/cron.d/cronctl-<id>. Applied to all schedule entries.

build.description: Optional build step executed during sync (on the server) before deploying the job payload.

enabled.description: Whether to run the build step during sync.

entrypoint.description: Path to the build script inside the job directory.

run.description: Run configuration. The entrypoint is invoked by cron for each schedule entry.

entrypoint.description: Path to the run script inside the job directory.

schedule.description: List of schedule entries. Each item generates one cron line in /etc/cron.d/cronctl-<id>.

cron.description: 5-field cron expression (minute hour day month weekday).

args.description: Arguments passed to the run entrypoint.

env.description: Environment variables for this specific schedule entry. Merged with top-level env; per-entry values override.

silent.description: Suppress command output by redirecting to /dev/null. Appends >/dev/null 2>&1 to the command.
